hypothesis_content.title: BTC-ETH Cointegration Breakout Pairs Trade
hypothesis_content.statement: When the 20-day rolling z-score of the BTC/ETH price ratio exceeds ±2.0 standard deviations from its 200-day mean, a mean reversion trade in the opposite direction will be profitable within 10 trading days, provided the overall market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: BTC and ETH are the two largest crypto assets with high liquidity and a historically stable long-term correlation. In neutral/bull regimes, their ratio tends to mean-revert due to capital rotation and shared macro drivers, but deviations can be exaggerated by short-term sentiment flows.
entry_conditions: BTC/ETH 20-day rolling z-score > +2.0: Short BTC, Long ETH (value-weighted to dollar-neutral)
BTC/ETH 20-day rolling z-score < -2.0: Long BTC, Short ETH (value-weighted to dollar-neutral)
Market regime is NEUTRAL or BULL (confidence > 60%)
30-day realized volatility of the ratio is below its 90-day 75th percentile (avoid volatility spikes)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Z-score crosses back through 0.5 (in the direction of the mean)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Z-score moves an additional 0.5 standard deviations away from the mean (e.g., entry at +2.0, stop at +2.5)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of trades initiated under these conditions result in a loss, or the average win rate is not statistically significantly greater than 50% over a sample of 100+ signals.
